      • getTaskName

        public static java.lang.String getTaskName(StateStore stateStore,
                                           Protos.TaskStatus taskStatus)
                                    throws StateStoreException
        Verifies that the supplied TaskStatus corresponds to a single TaskInfo in the provided StateStore and returns the TaskInfo.
        Returns:
        The singular Protos.TaskInfo if it is present
        Throws:
        StateStoreException - if zero or multiple corresponding Protos.TaskInfos are found

      • repairTaskIDs

        static void repairTaskIDs(StateStore stateStore)
        TaskInfo and TaskStatus objects referring to the same Task name are not written atomically. It is therefore possible for the states across these elements to become out of sync. While the scheduler process is up they remain in sync. This method produces an initial synchronized state. For example:
        1. TaskInfo(name=foo, id=1) is written
        2. TaskStatus(name=foo, id=1, status=RUNNING) is written
        3. Task foo is reconfigured/relaunched
        4. TaskInfo(name=foo, id=2) is written
        5. Scheduler is restarted before new TaskStatus is written
        6. Scheduler comes back and sees TaskInfo(name=foo, id=2) and TaskStatus(name=foo, id=1, status=RUNNING)

      • isUninstalling

        public static boolean isUninstalling(StateStore stateStore)
                              throws StateStoreException
        Returns the current value of the 'uninstall' property in the provided StateStore. If the StateStore was created against a namespaced service, then this returns whether that service is uninstalling.
        Throws:
        StateStoreException

      • setUninstalling

        public static void setUninstalling(StateStore stateStore)
        Sets an 'uninstall' property in the provided StateStore to true. If the StateStore was created against a namespaced service, then this flags that service as uninstalling. This value may be checked using isUninstalling(StateStore).

        protected static boolean fetchBooleanProperty(StateStore stateStore,
                                              java.lang.String propertyName)

                                             Protos.TaskStatus taskStatus)
                                      throws StateStoreException
        Stores a TaskStatus as a Property in the provided state store.
        Throws:

                                                                              java.lang.String taskName)

      • setDeploymentWasCompleted

        public static void setDeploymentWasCompleted(StateStore stateStore)
        Sets whether the service has previously completed deployment.

      • getDeploymentWasCompleted

        public static boolean getDeploymentWasCompleted(StateStore stateStore)
        Gets whether the service has previously completed deployment. If this is true, then any configuration changes should be treated as an update rather than a new deployment.
